title: Haussmann's Paris: Demolition as Design
description: A quick win: understand Haussmann's Paris: Demolition as Design.

hook.text: In the 1850s, Baron Haussmann demolished 20,000 medieval buildings to create the Paris we know today.

buildup.text: Napoleon III wanted wide boulevards to project imperial power â€” and prevent barricades during revolutions.

discovery.text: Haussmann's design included uniform building heights, tree-lined avenues, and a sewer system for 2 million.

twist.text: The project displaced 350,000 working-class Parisians to the outskirts, creating inequality that persists today.

climax.text: Haussmann proved that beautiful cities can be built â€” but the cost is often borne by those who get displaced.

punchline.text: Paris is beautiful because 350,000 people were moved out.

quiz.question: What hidden purpose did Haussmann's wide boulevards serve?
